alert.note: Alert for Monterey (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 10 at 3:35PM PST until January 10 at 7:15PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Francisco has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Monterey County in central California... * Until 715 PM PST. * At 335 PM PST, Local law enforcement reported flash flooding in the immediate areas around the Salinas River. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of Salinas River, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Soledad, Greenfield, King City, Gonzales, San Lucas, San Ardo and Bradley. This includes the following streams and drainages... Miners Gulch, Sargent Canyon, San Jacinto Creek, Nacimiento River, Pine Creek, Vineyard Canyon, Big Sandy Creek, San Antonio River, Reliz Creek, Mission Creek, Chalone Creek, Powell Canyon, Seco, Arroyo, Murry Creek, Monroe Creek, San Lorenzo Creek, Willow Creek, McCoy Creek, Jolon Creek, Hames Creek, Salinas River, Sand Creek, Vaqueros Creek, Stonewall Creek, McGowan Canyon, Topo Creek and Pancho Rico Creek. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
